Class Frustum

Frustum-based perspective projection configuration for a Camera.

  • Located at {@link Camera#frustum}.
  • Allows to explicitly set the positions of the left, right, top, bottom, near and far planes, which is useful for asymmetrical view volumes, such as for stereo viewing.
  • {@link Frustum#near} and {@link Frustum#far} specify the distances to the clipping planes.
  • Frustum.onProjMatrix will fire an event whenever Frustum.projMatrix updates, which indicates that one or more other properties have updated.

    • Frustum

unproject

  • unproject(canvasPos: FloatArrayParam, screenZ: number, screenPos: FloatArrayParam, viewPos: FloatArrayParam, worldPos: FloatArrayParam): FloatArrayParam
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/camera/Frustum.ts:272

    Un-projects the given Canvas-space coordinates, using this Frustum projection.

    Parameters

    • canvasPos: FloatArrayParam

      Inputs 2D Canvas-space coordinates.

    • screenZ: number

      Inputs Screen-space Z coordinate.

    • screenPos: FloatArrayParam

      Outputs 3D Screen/Clip-space coordinates.

    • viewPos: FloatArrayParam

      Outputs un-projected 3D View-space coordinates.

    • worldPos: FloatArrayParam

      Outputs un-projected 3D World-space coordinates.

    Returns FloatArrayParam
